events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their car and another vehicle on the highway yesterday evening.
The claim was reviewed and correctly categorised under Auto Accident after assessing the initial report details.
An insurance agent was assigned promptly to the case to ensure faster communication and handling of the claim.
Acknowledgement of the claim was sent to the customer confirming receipt and outlining the next steps.
Additional documents including photos of vehicle damage and police report were requested to proceed with the investigation.
Customer submitted all required documentation, including detailed photographs and a copy of the police collision report.
The investigation team commenced a detailed review of submitted materials and contacted involved parties for additional information.
Investigation findings were compiled and reviewed, confirming liability and extent of damages caused to the vehicle.
A settlement offer was presented to the customer outlining the approved compensation amount for repairs and associated costs.
The customer expressed dissatisfaction with the proposed settlement amount, requesting a review for higher compensation.
Due to customer concerns, the claim was escalated to the senior claims adjuster for further evaluation.
After reassessment, the claim was approved with an increased settlement amount in response to the customer's feedback.
Payment was promptly processed and issued to the customerâ€™s account to cover the agreed-upon repair costs.
The claim was officially closed following customer confirmation of receipt of payment and satisfaction with the resolution.
